00017 /*******************************************************************/
00018 /*  Usage     : read_gtp_input()                                   */
00019 /*  Purpose   : Reads a GTP command from STDIN.                    */
00020 /*  Parameter : Pointer to command struct                          */
00021 /*  Returns   : Nothing                                            */
00022 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00023 /*  Comment   : Compare with "gnugo --mode gtp"                    */
00024 /*            : Input larger than SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER is simply      */
00025 /*            : ignored.                                           */
00026 /*  See also  : http://www.lysator.liu.se/~gunnar/gtp/             */
00027 /*******************************************************************/
00028 
00040 void read_gtp_input( struct command *command_data )
00041 {
00042     int c = '\n';
00043     int i = 0;
00044     char tokens[MAX_TOKEN_COUNT][MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH];
00045 
00046     init_tokens(tokens);
00047 
00048     input_empty  = false;
00049     output_error = false;
00050 
00051     do {
00052         c = getchar();
00053         command_input_buffer[i] = (char) c;
00054         i++;
00055     } while ( c != '\n' && i < SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER );
00056 
00057     // Overwrite last char with newline
00058     command_input_buffer[i-1] = '\0';
00059 
00060     drop_comment(command_input_buffer);
00061     trim(command_input_buffer);
00062 
00063     if ( strlen(command_input_buffer) == 0 ) {
00064         input_empty = true;
00065         return;
00066     }
00067 
00068     parse_gtp_input( command_input_buffer, tokens );
00069     identify_tokens( tokens, command_data );
00070 
00071     return;
00072 }

00105 /*******************************************************************/
00106 /*  Usage     : add_output()                                       */
00107 /*  Purpose   : Adds the given string to the output variable       */
00108 /*  Parameter : String                                             */
00109 /*  Returns   : Nothing                                            */
00110 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00111 /*  Comment   : Only complete lines must be given to this          */
00112 /*            : function. A new line is appended automatically.    */
00113 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00114 /*******************************************************************/
00115 void add_output( const char to_output[] ) {
00116 
00117     int new_output_length
00118         = (int)( strlen(output) + strlen(to_output) + 1 );
00119     if ( new_output_length > MAX_OUTPUT_LENGTH ) {
00120         fprintf( stderr, "MAX_OUTPUT_LENGTH exceeded\n" );
00121         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00122     }
00123 
00124     strcat( output, to_output );
00125     strcat( output, "\n" );
00126 
00127     return;
00128 }

00140 void print_output( int command_id ) {
00141 
00142     /*
00143     if ( input_empty == true ) {
00144         input_empty = false;
00145         return;
00146     }
00147     */
00148 
00149     if ( output_error == false ) {
00150         printf("=");
00151     }
00152     else {
00153         printf("?");
00154     }
00155 
00156     if ( command_id >= 0 ) {
00157         printf( "%d", command_id );
00158     }
00159 
00160     printf(" ");
00161     
00162     // If output is empty we fill it with an empty string to
00163     // get that additional newline:
00164     if ( strlen(output) == 0 ) {
00165         add_output("");
00166     }
00167 
00168     printf( "%s\n", output );
00169 
00170     my_strcpy( output, "", MAX_OUTPUT_LENGTH );
00171     //output_error = false;
00172 
00173     return;
00174 }

00176 /*******************************************************************/
00177 /*  Usage     : trim()                                             */
00178 /*  Purpose   : Trims string.                                      */
00179 /*  Parameter : Input string                                       */
00180 /*  Returns   : Trimmed string                                     */
00181 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00182 /*  Comment   : Whitespace at the beginning and end are dropped.   */
00183 /*            : Two or more whitespaces are substituted by one     */
00184 /*            : whitespace.                                        */
00185 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00186 /*******************************************************************/
00187 void trim( char * input ) {
00188     char temp_input[SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER];
00189     char current_char = '\0';
00190     char last_char    = '\0';
00191     int i = 0;
00192     int j = 0;
00193 
00194     for ( i = 0; i < SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER; i++ ) {
00195         current_char = input[i];
00196 
00197         /* Skip leading whitespace */
00198         if ( isspace(current_char) && j == 0 ) {
00199             continue;
00200         }
00201         
00202         /* Write only one whitespace */
00203         if ( isspace(last_char) && !isspace(current_char) && current_char != '\0' ) {
00204             temp_input[j] = ' ';
00205             j++;
00206         }
00207 
00208         /* Write non-whitespace characters */
00209         if ( ! isspace(current_char) ) {
00210             temp_input[j] = current_char;
00211             j++;
00212         }
00213 
00214         last_char = current_char;
00215     }
00216 
00217     temp_input[j] = '\0';
00218 
00219     strncpy( input, temp_input, SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER );
00220 
00221     return;
00222 }
00223 
00224 /*******************************************************************/
00225 /*  Usage     : drop_comment()                                     */
00226 /*  Purpose   : Drop trailing comment from input string.           */
00227 /*  Parameter : Input string                                       */
00228 /*  Returns   : String without trailing comment.                   */
00229 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00230 /*  Comment   : The comment character '#' is substituted with '\0' */
00231 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00232 /*******************************************************************/
00233 void drop_comment( char * input ) {
00234     int i = 0;
00235     char current_char = '\0';
00236 
00237     for ( i = 0; i < SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER; i++ ) {
00238         current_char = input[i];
00239         if ( current_char == '#' ) {
00240             input[i] = '\0';
00241             break;
00242         }
00243         if ( current_char == '\0' ) {
00244             break;
00245         }
00246     }
00247 
00248     return;
00249 }
00250

00260 bool is_input_empty(void) {

00262     return input_empty;
00263 }

00265 /*******************************************************************/
00266 /*  Usage     : parse_gtp_input()                                  */
00267 /*  Purpose   : Parses the GTP input.                              */
00268 /*  Parameter : Input string, command                              */
00269 /*  Returns   : GTP command and optional arguments                 */
00270 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00271 /*  Comment   : The input has to go through drop_comment() and     */
00272 /*            : trim() before being parsed.                        */
00273 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00274 /*******************************************************************/
00275 void parse_gtp_input( char * command_input_buffer, char tokens[][MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH] ) {
00276     char current_char = '\0';
00277     int i = 0;  // Index of input buffer
00278     int j = 0;  // Counts number of tokens
00279     int k = 0;  // Index of each token
00280 
00281     // Get tokens from input:
00282     for ( i = 0; i < SIZE_INPUT_BUFFER; i++ ) {
00283         current_char = command_input_buffer[i];
00284         if ( ! isspace(current_char) && current_char != '\0' ) {
00285             if ( k < MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH ) {
00286                 tokens[j][k] = current_char;
00287                 k++;
00288             }
00289             else {
00290                 set_output_error();
00291                 add_output( "MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH exceeded" );
00292                 init_tokens(tokens);
00293                 return;
00294             }
00295         }
00296         else {
00297             tokens[j][k] = '\0';
00298             j++;
00299             k = 0;
00300 
00301             if ( j >= MAX_TOKEN_COUNT ) {
00302                 set_output_error();
00303                 add_output( "MAX_TOKEN_COUNT exceeded" );
00304                 init_tokens(tokens);
00305                 return;
00306             }
00307 
00308             // Set terminating argument:
00309             tokens[j][0] = '\0';
00310         }
00311 
00312         if ( current_char == '\0' ) {
00313             break;
00314         }
00315     }
00316 
00317     return;
00318 }
00319 
00320 /*******************************************************************/
00321 /*  Usage     : init_tokens()                                      */
00322 /*  Purpose   : Sets all token data strings to '\0'                */
00323 /*  Parameter : None                                               */
00324 /*  Returns   : Nothing                                            */
00325 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00326 /*  Comment   : None                                               */
00327 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00328 /*******************************************************************/
00329 void init_tokens( char tokens[][MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH] ) {
00330     int i;
00331 
00332     for ( i = 0; i < MAX_TOKEN_COUNT; i++ ) {
00333         tokens[i][0] = '\0';
00334     }
00335 
00336     return;
00337 }
00338 
00339 /*******************************************************************/
00340 /*  Usage     : identify_tokens()                                  */
00341 /*  Purpose   : Tries to identify the different parts of the       */
00342 /*            : tokens array: id, command name, arguments          */
00343 /*  Parameter : Tokens array, Pointer to struct command            */
00344 /*  Returns   : Nothing                                            */
00345 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00346 /*  Comment   : This function moves the data from the tokens array */
00347 /*            : to the command struct.                             */
00348 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00349 /*******************************************************************/
00350 void identify_tokens( char tokens[][MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH], struct command *command_data ) {
00351     int id;
00352     int arg_start;  // Index of first argument
00353     int i, j;
00354 
00355     // Check if first token is regular id,
00356     // if not it must be the command name.
00357     id = atoi( tokens[0] );
00358     if ( id > 0 ) {
00359         command_data->id = id;
00360         my_strcpy( command_data->name, tokens[1], MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH );
00361         arg_start = 2;
00362     }
00363     else if ( id < 0 ) {
00364         command_data->id = -1;
00365         my_strcpy( command_data->name, tokens[1], MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH );
00366         arg_start = 2;
00367     }
00368     else {
00369         command_data->id = -1;
00370         my_strcpy( command_data->name, tokens[0], MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH );
00371         arg_start = 1;
00372     }
00373 
00374     // Check for special case id 0:
00375     if ( strcmp( tokens[0], "0" ) == 0 ) {
00376         command_data->id = 0;
00377         my_strcpy( command_data->name, tokens[1], MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH );
00378         arg_start = 2;
00379     }
00380 
00381     // Copy arguments into command struct:
00382     j = 0;
00383     for ( i = arg_start; i < MAX_TOKEN_COUNT; i++ ) {
00384         if ( tokens[i][0] == '\0' ) {
00385             break;
00386         }
00387         my_strcpy( command_data->gtp_argv[j], tokens[i], MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH );
00388         j++;
00389     }
00390     command_data->gtp_argc = j;
00391 
00392     // Add terminating argument:
00393     my_strcpy( command_data->gtp_argv[j], "\0", MAX_TOKEN_LENGTH );
00394 
00395     // DEBUG
00396     /*
00397     printf( "ID: %d\n", command_data->id );
00398     printf( "NAME: %s\n", command_data->name );
00399     printf( "ARGC: %d\n", command_data->argc );
00400     for ( i = 0; i < j; i++ ) {
00401         printf( "ARG %d: %s\n", i, command_data->argv[i] );
00402     }
00403     */
00404 
00405     return;
00406 }
